Cannone da 47/32 M35.notes: Primary AT weapon for parachute artillery regiment

Mortaio da 81/14 Modello 35.notes: Organic to parachute mortar company and regiment support

supply_status.notes: Critical supply situation during El Alamein battle. Division isolated and encircled.

tactical_doctrine.role: Elite parachute division employed as ordinary infantry in defensive operations at El Alamein
special_capabilities: Airborne qualified (not employed in airborne role in North Africa)
Light infantry with emphasis on anti-tank defense
tactical_innovations: Used as elite light infantry rather than in parachute role
Formed strong defensive positions with limited AT weapons
known_issues: Lack of heavy weapons and armor
Insufficient anti-tank capability against British armor
Vulnerable to armor assault without heavy support
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Division adapted parachute tactics to desert warfare, emphasizing mobile defense and anti-tank ambush positions

special_rules: Elite Paratrooper: +1 morale in defensive combat
Light Infantry: Enhanced movement in rough terrain
Stubborn Defense: May re-roll failed morale checks when defending prepared positions
Supply Crisis: -1 to all combat rolls after turn 3 due to supply shortages
historical_engagements: Battle of El Alamein (23 October - 4 November 1942) - Division destroyed
Fighting withdrawal and final destruction (4-5 November 1942)
wargaming_data.historical_notes: The Folgore Division fought with exceptional courage at El Alamein, holding their positions against overwhelming odds. Of approximately 5,200 men, only about 300 survived as prisoners. The division was annihilated in place, refusing to surrender until ammunition and water were exhausted. One of the finest Italian units of WWII.

historical_status.fate: Division destroyed at El Alamein. Approximately 4,500 casualties/POWs from 5,200 strength. Remnants absorbed into 184th NEMBO Division in 1943.
historical_status.notes: This TO&E represents the division's strength at the beginning of the Battle of El Alamein (23 October 1942). By November 4-5, 1942 (end of Q4), the division had been completely destroyed. British General Bernard Montgomery stated: 'We must really hand it to the Italians... they fought magnificently.'

source: Order of Battle of the Italian Army, USA HQ G2, July 1943 (Primary Source)
TME 30-420 Italian Military Forces 1943 (US War Department Technical Manual)
Historical records of Battle of El Alamein
known_gaps: Commander name not identified in source documents (marked as 'Unknown' per schema guidance)
Chief of Staff name not identified
Exact variant distribution of some weapons estimated based on typical Italian parachute division organization
Precise subordinate unit strengths calculated from division total using standard parachute regiment organization
Motorcycle company strength estimated from standard Italian practice
validation.data_quality_notes: Division was destroyed during the quarter being documented (Q4 1942). TO&E represents strength at start of El Alamein battle (October 23, 1942) before destruction. Commander information missing from primary sources - marked as 'Unknown' with confidence reflected accordingly. Historical status section added to clearly document division's fate.
validation.source_notes: US G2 OOB document explicitly states division was 'largely destroyed at El Alamein in November 1942.' TME 30-420 confirms Folgore 'was destroyed while fighting as infantry in Egypt.' Organization based on standard Italian parachute division structure documented in same sources.
